TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit PersonalizationEntry extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents core pieces of custom personalization state information contained in a object. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This class represents pieces of custom state information contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary> object made available by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.IPersonalizable> interface. This information is used by other classes and interfaces in the personalization infrastructure.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(object value, valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationScope scope) cil managed

Docs.param: An object of personalization data associated with the personalization scope in the scope parameter.
The that applies to the custom personalization information.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified value and scope.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Note that the custom state information contained in the `value` parameter must have an associated scope as specified in the `scope` parameter. Entries in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationDictionary> must explicitly indicate whether a piece of custom data is considered personalizable in <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationScope.User> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationScope.Shared> scope.
In this constructor, the value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizableAttribute.IsSensitive%2A> property defaults to `false`.

Docs.exception: is set to a value that is not a valid member of .

MemberSignature.Value: public PersonalizationEntry (object value, System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationScope scope, bool isSensitive);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(object value, valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationScope scope, bool isSensitive) cil managed

Docs.param: An object of personalization data associated with the personalization scope in the scope parameter.
The that applies to the custom personalization information.
A Boolean value indicating if the custom state information is sensitive and should not be exported.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the provided parameters.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor allows you to create a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationEntry> that contains data that should not be serialized in the exported Web Part format. If you set the value of `isSensitive` to `true`, the Web Parts export handler will not serialize the data for export.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the Boolean value that indicates if the contains sensitive information.
Docs.value: if the sensitive setting for the attribute is set; otherwise .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Web Parts personalization information can contain sensitive data that should not be exported to other controls. This property is used by the Web Parts import and export process. Setting <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizableAttribute.IsSensitive%2A> to `true` causes the Web Parts export handler to not serialize the data in the exported Web Part format.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the personalization scope associated with this personalization data entry.
Docs.value: The personalization scope associated with this personalization data entry.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property's effect is similar to specifying the scope associated with a public property using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizableAttribute> class. You can use this property to set the personalization scope of the personalization information that makes up the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationEntry> instance. All entries must have a scope associated with it.

Docs.exception: is set to a value that is not a valid member of .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the personalization state information for this entry.
Docs.value: An object representing personalization state information.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Note that the custom state information contained in this property must have an associated scope, specified in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PersonalizationEntry.Scope%2A> property. This property can be set to `null`.
